ComicInfo.Series: The Pin-Up Art of Archie Dickens
ComicInfo.Summary:
"Cheeky", "saucy", "randy" are some British euphemisms that can be employed when describing the works of Archie Dickens. An Englishman from the old school, his fondness for lovely young innocents in not-so-innocent situations has delighted pin-up enthusiasts for several generations. Angelic faces with devilish designs has always been the hallmark of this illustrator. Each work reflects his sly wit and brilliant talent.
Back Blurb"Cheeky", "saucy", "randy" and a variety of other British Euphemisms can be employed when describing the works of Archie Dickens. An Englishman from the old school, his fondness for lovely young innocents in not-so-innocent situations has delighted pin-up enthusiasts throughout the world for several generations. A contemporary of such cheesecake gods as Gil Elvgren and Alberto Vargas, Archie Dickens has been able to do what they could not - successfully span TWO centuries.
STILL painting his unique brand of pretty girls well into his nineties, it seems Archie's been able to find the secret to longevity is the sight of a pretty girl.
Then there's hope for us all!
